item.title: Unleashed dogs causing safety and hygiene problems in Pickhurst Park and Norman Park, 8th October
item.description:
Description: I would like to raise a concern about the number of dogs being walked without a leash in Pickhurst Park and Norman Park. I have been chased and approached by dogs while running or cycling with my daughter, and in some cases, dogs have run over or fouled our picnic blanket while owners did not intervene or apologise. This is distressing and makes it difficult for families and children to use the parks safely. I request that the Council review the existing dog control rules and consider introducing enclosed dog exercise areas where dogs can run freely and safely. This approach has worked well in other boroughs and helps reduce conflicts between park users. Please could you let me know what action the Council plans to take regarding this issue?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mead Way, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet
